main event: A pilot reported sighting a brilliant white light exhibiting erratic maneuvers over Shaw AFB, S.C., on October 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object was circular in shape and estimated to be 20 to 30 feet in diameter,It emitted a brilliant white light three times as intense as sunlight,The pilot attempted to intercept the object twice but could not close distance,The sighting lasted for 23 minutes and ended when the object faded from view,No physical evidence or radar contact was established.
witness description: Pilot Capt. Billet, age 47, veteran of combat operations in the Korean War
